content.Collaborate and coordinate efforts: Collaborate with others and coordinate efforts as you work on outreach activities.
content.Contribute API documentation: Contribute API documentation by writing sample code and improving existing docs.
content.Contribute test cases: Contribute test cases by submitting PRs. This helps increase test coverage and improve the quality of the project.
content.Describe your interests: Describe your interests in the #hackers-devrel channel and start working on related activities.
content.Familiarize yourself with our issue hygi: Familiarize yourself with our issue hygiene, which covers the meanings of some important GitHub labels and milestones.
content.Flutter design doc template: Use the Flutter design doc template when proposing new technical designs. This is a good practice before coding intricate changes.
content.Get invited to the flutter-hackers team: Once you've been doing triage for a while, someone will invite you to the flutter-hackers team on GitHub, allowing you to add labels.
content.Help out as described in our triage guid: Help out as described in our triage guide. You can start by trying to reproduce problems, asking for more details, and pointing out duplicates.
content.Join Discord and introduce yourself: Join Discord and introduce yourself on the relevant channels to start contributing to API documentation.
content.Join Discord and ping Hixie: Join Discord and ping Hixie on the #hackers channel if you're interested in organizing social events.
content.Join the #hackers-devrel Discord channel: Join the #hackers-devrel Discord channel to start with developer relations and outreach activities.
content.Join the #hackers-triage Discord channel: Join the #hackers-triage Discord channel to start helping with issue triage. This is where you can communicate with other contributors and get guidance on how to proceed.
content.Join the #quality-assurance channel on D: Join the #quality-assurance channel on Discord to discuss your QA activities and get involved in testing beta releases.
content.Organize social interactions: Organize social interactions among the Flutter contributor community, such as video chats or tech talks.
content.Our style guide: Read our style guide for advice on designing APIs and formatting code in the framework.
content.Participate in release process: Participate in the release process by writing release notes, coordinating binary generation, and updating tooling.
content.Reach out on the #hackers-releases chann: Reach out on the #hackers-releases channel to get involved in the release process.
content.Read our code of conduct: Read our code of conduct, which stipulates explicitly that everyone must be gracious, respectful, and professional. This is important as you will be representing the Flutter team.
content.Read the style guide for documentation: Read the style guide for documentation to understand the conventions and style used in Flutter's API docs.
content.Setting up your engine development envir: Set up your engine development environment by following the steps in the provided document. This is necessary if you want to work on Flutter's engine.
content.Setting up your framework development en: Set up your framework development environment to work on Flutter's framework, which mainly uses Dart.
content.Submit bug reports: Submit bug reports without needing anyone's permission. This is a valuable contribution to the project.
content.Tree hygiene: Learn about tree hygiene, which covers how to land a PR, do code reviews, and handle regressions.

edges.target: Help out as described in our triage guide

edges.source: Help out as described in our triage guide
edges.target: Familiarize yourself with our issue hygiene
